intro: Sabatia nervosa, commonly known as the slender sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in open areas such as fields and dunes. It has opposite, narrow leaves with prominent veins, which give it its scientific name "nervosa." Sabatia nervosa is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to thrive in well-drained, sunny environments.
